start.description: The lower bound of an animation clip.

end.description: The upper bound of an animation clip.
end.gltf_detailedDescription: When defined, `end` **MUST** be greater or equal than `start`. If `end` is undefined, client implementations **SHOULD** use an infinite floating number value.

timestamp.gltf_detailedDescription: This value **MUST** be greater or equal than `start` and smaller or equal than `end`.

direction.description: The direction and speed used for updating the `timestamp`.
direction.gltf_detailedDescription: This value allows to run an animation forward (`direction` > 0.0) or backward (`direction` < 0.0). It allows to increase (abs(`direction`) > 1.0) or decrease (abs(`direction`) < 1.0) the speed of the animation. `direction` = 0.0 stops the animation clip.

repetitions.description: The number of times the animation is looped.
repetitions.gltf_detailedDescription: Not defined or -1 means infinite loops. 0 means the animation is not played at all. 1 means the animation is played once. A value of n > 1 means the animation is repeated n times.

bounce.description: Specifies whether the animation should bounce or loop.
bounce.gltf_detailedDescription: If an animation is repeated, the animation begins from the `start` (`end` for a backward animation.) again. If an animation is bounced, `direction` becomes -1.0 * `direction` if the `timestamp` gets larger or smaller than `end` or `start`.
